Description: Fragment of circular lense-shaped object with sharp edges, in white-grey translucent marble; 1.7cm wide zone around edges on both sides smoothed, centre roughly picked (the centre preserved only on one side, other side broken off so not sure if same here); fragment of architecture reused as a grinding-stone (?).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The cemetery as the findspot is indicated in the EEF distribution list for Boston.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (TI.65)
